I've seen this idea recently (Portuguese Gambit?) played and commented here on GK, and I gave it a try.
The N is pinned, so I could have gone for Nd7, threatening Ne5.
The problem with Bc4 is that it prevents white to play c4 instead, so this N take is just fine!
OH, well, of course... backwards? Never! :-) (just joking, don't play chess like that, please! :-D
It looks dreadful, because if Nf6, Qxb7.
It looks dreadful, because if Nf6, Qxb7.
But this simple move saves it all. Because white can't play c4 now.
Here I could have gone for the complications of Nb4 (allowing Qxb7 for Nxc2+, cashing the R after saving my own... oh, I already played this one, and it's very complicated!)
This saves it all, because now even if white manages to play c4, my N can safely leave this square, since b7 is defended.
Very important: I have to use my dark squares to create pressure.
Very important: I have to use my dark squares to create pressure.
?? I don't think that QxB gave some compensation to white. It was just a blunder and I...
?? I played authomaticly this move, without even realizing that the WB was "free of charge", so concerned I was about b2's AND c2's weaknesses..
? This stops forever the c4 option for white, and allows for a future b5 threat...

? The threat on c2 must control white, because he has very dangerous sacs like Bxc6. On the other side, I will spend a tempo castling ONLY if absolutely needed. I need my tempoes for my own attack. BUT much more important was Be5, forcing c3, and only then Nb4, where if cxN, BxR.
! Now white's threat is even worse! And, besides, Be5 is not possible anymore!!! Time to castle?
NO! This is many times more efficient to stop white's threats.
? White has to go on, and Kh1, allowing f4 - f5 would have been black's next challenge. But this move goes for a slower plan.
If I am not forced to castle, why to concede a tempo? Better is to develop.

white is going for a pawn storm on the Qside! Wow! Very interesting, but not for a blitz. The correct procedure for black (IMO!) is a5. b5 by white is just ok, bxc6, bxc6 goes in black's favour and doesn't concede anything.
This is now very strong, but it comes too late.
